about.summary: Implements methods for centrality related analyses of networks.  While the package includes the possibility to build more than 20 indices,  its main focus lies on index-free assessment of centrality via partial  rankings obtained by neighborhood-inclusion or positional dominance. These  partial rankings can be analyzed with different methods, including  probabilistic methods like computing expected node ranks and relative  rank probabilities (how likely is it that a node is more central than another?). The methodology is described in depth in the vignettes and in Schoch (2018) <doi:10.1016/j.socnet.2017.12.003>.

name: r-netrankr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.2.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-netrankr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: netrankr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/netrankr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/netrankr/netrankr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 54eb148ea1e2447301ac0aa2adf4c9d0ff2c7ba2a7807e267ffe5c1913884f33

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1002
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}      # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.8
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-igraph >=1.0.1
  run:
    - r-base
    - {{ native }}gcc-libs         # [win]
    - r-rcpp >=0.12.8
    - r-rcpparmadillo
    - r-igraph >=1.0.1

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('netrankr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('netrankr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://schochastics.github.io/netrankr
  license: MIT
  summary: Implements methods for centrality related analyses of networks.  While the package includes the possibility to build more than 20 indices,  its main focus lies on index-free assessment of centrality via partial  rankings obtained by neighborhood-inclusion or positional dominance. These  partial rankings can be
    analyzed with different methods, including  probabilistic methods like computing expected node ranks and relative  rank probabilities (how likely is it that a node is more central than another?). The methodology is described in depth in the vignettes and in Schoch (2018) <doi:10.1016/j.socnet.2017.12.003>.
  license_family: MIT

  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE
extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - johanneskoester
    - bgruening
    - daler
    - jdblischak
    - cbrueffer
    - dbast
    - apcamargo
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
